prefix: How well do the following statements describe the United States as of today?

prompts.question_text: Parties and candidates are not barred due to their political beliefs and ideologies.
prompts.short_text: Parties/candidates not barred for beliefs and ideologies.

prompts.question_text: Citizens have access to information about candidates that is relevant to how they would govern.
prompts.short_text: Citizens have access to relevant info about candidates.

prompts.question_text: Even when there are disagreements about ideology or policy, political leaders generally share a common understanding of relevant facts.
prompts.short_text: Political leaders share a common understanding of facts.

prompts.question_text: Elected officials seek compromise with political opponents.
prompts.short_text: Elected officials seek compromise with opponents.

prompts.question_text: Politicians who lose free and fair elections will concede defeat.
prompts.short_text: Politicians who lose free and fair elections concede.

prompts.question_text: Public policy is not determined by large campaign contributions.
prompts.short_text: Policy not determined by campaign contributions.

prompts.question_text: The geographic boundaries of electoral districts do not systematically advantage any particular political party.
prompts.short_text: District boundaries do not advantage any party.

prompts.question_text: Elections are conducted, ballots counted, and winners determined without pervasive fraud or manipulation.
prompts.short_text: Elections are free of fraud.

prompts.question_text: The law is enforced equally for all persons.
prompts.short_text: The law is enforced equally for all.

prompts.question_text: All adult citizens enjoy the same legal and political rights.
prompts.short_text: All citizens enjoy the same rights.

prompts.question_text: Executive authority cannot be expanded beyond constitutional limits.
prompts.short_text: Executive authority not expanded beyond constitituional limits.

prompts.question_text: Elections are free from foreign influence.
prompts.short_text: Elections are free from foreign influence.

prompts.question_text: Government protects individuals' right to engage in unpopular speech or expression.
prompts.short_text: Government protects individuals' right to unpopular speech.

prompts.question_text: Information about the sources of campaign funding is available to the public.
prompts.short_text: Information about the sources of campaign funding is available.

prompts.question_text: Government statistics and data are produced by experts who are not influenced by political considerations.
prompts.short_text: Goverment statistics and data not influenced by politics.

prompts.question_text: Law enforcement investigations of public officials or their associates are free from political influence or interference.
prompts.short_text: Legal investigations of public official free from political influence.

prompts.question_text: Government does not interfere with journalists or news organizations.
prompts.short_text: Government does not interfere with the media.

prompts.question_text: The elected branches respect judicial independence.
prompts.short_text: Elected branches respect judicial independence.

prompts.question_text: The judiciary is able to effectively limit executive power.
prompts.short_text: Judiciary can limit executive power.

prompts.question_text: The legislature is able to effectively limit executive power.
prompts.short_text: Legislature can limit executive power.

prompts.question_text: Government officials are legally sanctioned for misconduct.
prompts.short_text: Officials legally sanctioned for misconduct

prompts.question_text: Government agencies are not used to monitor, attack, or punish political opponents.
prompts.short_text: Agencies not used to attack political opponents.

prompts.question_text: Citizens can make their opinions heard in open debate about policies that are under consideration.
prompts.short_text: Citizens can make their opinions heard.

prompts.question_text: Voter participation in elections is generally high.
prompts.short_text: Voter participation is high.

prompts.question_text: Political competition occurs without criticism of opponents' loyalty or patriotism.
prompts.short_text: Political competitions occurs without criticism of loyalty/patriotism.

prompts.question_text: Government officials do not use public office for private gain.
prompts.short_text: Officials do not use public office for private gain.

prompts.question_text: Government effectively prevents private actors from engaging in politically-motivated violence or intimidation.
prompts.short_text: Private actors prevented from political violence/intimidation.

prompts.question_text: Government protects individuals' right to engage in peaceful protest.
prompts.short_text: Government protects individuals' right to protest

prompts.question_text: In the elected branches, majorities act with restraint and reciprocity.
prompts.short_text: Elected majorities act with restraint and reciprocity.

prompts.question_text: Government leaders recognize the validity of bureaucratic or scientific consensus.
prompts.short_text: Leaders recognize validity of bureaucratic and scientific consensus.

prompts.question_text: All votes have equal impact on election outcomes.
prompts.short_text: All votes have equal impact.

prompts.question_text: All adult citizens have equal opportunity to vote.
prompts.short_text: All citizens have equal opportunity to vote.
